response:
Investigations should confirm the presence of an optic neuropathy, define structural lesions on MRI, and evaluate for demyelinating, autoimmune, infectious, and vascular causes while establishing a safe baseline for potential immunosuppressive therapy.

investigations = ["Urgent ophthalmology assessment with dilated fundus examination", "Visual acuity testing with pinhole correction", "Color vision testing using Ishihara plates", "Automated visual field testing (perimetry)", "Optical coherence tomography of the retinal nerve fiber layer and macula", "MRI of brain and orbits with gadolinium contrast including dedicated optic nerve sequences", "Visual evoked potentials", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "C-reactive protein", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "Blood glucose", "Serum vitamin B12", "Serum folate", "Serum aquaporin-4 IgG antibodies", "Serum MOG-IgG antibodies", "Antinuclear antibody", "Extractable nuclear antigen panel", "Angiotensin-converting enzyme level", "Syphilis serology", "HIV 1 and 2 serology", "Antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibodies", "Lumbar puncture with CSF cell count, protein, and glucose", "CSF oligoclonal bands and IgG index"]
